summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the submission of a detention letter for Jeffrey Epstein and a decision not to show photographs to Judge Berman. It reveals internal coordination regarding the prosecution's strategy and judicial communication.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge whose chambers were contacted; he indicated he did not want to see photographs in relation to the case.

events.title: Internal Discussion on Detention Submission
events.description: Prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinate via email on finalizing and submitting a detention letter for Jeffrey Epstein, and decide against showing photographs to Judge Berman.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated July 16, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest.
Prosecutors were preparing a detention submission for Jeffrey Epstein.
Judge Berman's chambers were contacted and the judge explicitly stated he did not want to see photographs, so prosecutors decided not to bring them.
The correspondence shows internal coordination among Assistant U.S. Attorneys on case strategy.
The document is part of the evidence set (EFTA00014471) related to the Epstein case.
